name.description: Human-readable display name of the asset.

qualified_name.description: Globally-unique technical identifier for the asset.

description.description: Short prose description of the asset’s purpose.

readme.description: Long-form documentation including examples and caveats.

owner_users.description: Individual users accountable for the asset.

owner_groups.description: Groups or teams accountable for the asset.

steward_users.description: Stewards responsible for metadata quality for the asset.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the asset was created in Atlan.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the asset was last updated in Atlan.

created_by.description: User who created the asset in Atlan.

updated_by.description: User who last updated the asset’s metadata.

tags.description: Business or technical tags applied to the asset.

domain.description: Business domain owning or responsible for the asset.

subdomain.description: Field name,Description,Source doc URL,Asset types,Use case(s),Core vs Recommended,Sample enum values

certificate_status.description: Governance certificate or status of the asset.

lifecycle_stage.description: Stage in the lifecycle of the asset.

planned_retirement_date.description: Planned date when the asset will be retired.

consumer_impact_if_wrong.description: Impact on consumers if the asset is wrong or stale.

metadata_completeness_score.description: Composite score summarizing how fully the asset is enriched.

glossary_enrichment_level.description: Percentage of terms in a glossary that are enriched.

connection_name.description: Logical Atlan connection name for the source system.

table_name.description: Physical table name in the schema.

row_count.description: Approximate number of rows in a table or view.

size_bytes.description: Approximate storage size of the table.

partition_keys.description: List of partition keys defined on the table.

clustering_keys.description: List of clustering or distribution keys.

table_owner_system.description: Owner or schema owner in the source system.

data_type.description: Column data type in the source system.

logical_type.description: Normalized semantic type of the column.

is_nullable.description: Whether the column allows null values.

default_value.description: Default value defined for the column.

primary_key.description: Whether the column is part of the primary key.

foreign_key.description: Whether the column participates in a foreign key.

referenced_table.description: Table referenced by the foreign key.

referenced_column.description: Column referenced by the foreign key.

column_profile_null_pct.description: Profiling: fraction of rows that are null.

term_definition_short.description: One-line, plain-language definition of the term.

term_definition_long.description: Detailed description of the term including scope and non-goals.

term_examples.description: Examples illustrating how to interpret or use the term.

term_scope.description: Description of what is in-scope and out-of-scope for the term.

related_terms.description: Terms related to this term (synonyms, parents, children).

glossary_name.description: Name of the glossary this term belongs to.

glossary_category.description: Category or sub-domain classification of the term.

metric_name.description: Display name of the metric or KPI.

metric_formula.description: Business definition or expression for how the metric is calculated.

metric_grain.description: The grain at which the metric is defined.

metric_source_asset.description: Canonical table or view that powers the metric.

metric_filters.description: Required filters or constraints for correct interpretation of the metric.

metric_sla.description: Freshness or availability SLA for the metric.

metric_owner_business.description: Business owner responsible for the metric.

dq_score.description: Composite data quality score for the asset.

pii_flag.description: Whether the asset or column contains PII.

sensitivity_classification.description: Overall sensitivity level of the data.

regulatory_scope.description: Regulatory regimes that apply to the data.

processing_activity.description: High-level description of the processing activity.

legal_basis.description: Legal basis for processing personal data.

lf_tag_name.description: AWS Lake Formation tag name mapped from an Atlan tag.

model_type.description: Type or family of the model.

model_owner_business.description: Business owner for the model’s outcomes.

model_owner_technical.description: ML engineer / data scientist accountable for the model.

model_training_data_assets.description: Linked training datasets used to train the model.

model_serving_data_assets.description: Linked datasets used at inference time.

model_performance_metric.description: Primary performance metric(s) for the model.

model_training_data_range.description: Time range covered by training data.

model_risk_rating.description: Qualitative risk rating of the model.

ai_readiness_score.description: Aggregate score for AI readiness of data and metadata.

data_product_description.description: Description of the data product’s scope and value.

data_product_owner_team.description: Team that owns the data product.

data_product_sla.description: SLA for freshness and availability of the data product.

data_product_maturity.description: Maturity level of the data product.

data_product_kpi.description: KPIs used to measure the product’s business value.

source_qualified_name.description: Upstream asset qualified name in lineage.

target_qualified_name.description: Downstream asset qualified name in lineage.

transformation_type.description: Type of transformation between source and target.

job_name.description: Name of the job or pipeline.

last_run_status.description: Status of the last job run.

failure_rate_30d.description: Failure rate of the job over the last 30 days.

bi_folder.description: Folder or path for the BI asset.

bi_url.description: Direct URL for the dashboard or report.

sheet_name.description: Worksheet or tab name inside the BI asset.

filter_summary.description: Textual description of global filters in the BI asset.

is_certified_report.description: Whether the BI asset is certified.

domain_value_score.description: Value score for the domain from value/viability assessment.

is_documented.description: Whether the asset has both description and readme.

badge_name.description: Name of the badge shown on assets.

badge_description.description: Description of what the badge means for consumers.

badge_condition_expression.description: Logical condition (using other fields) under which the badge is applied.

badge_priority.description: Priority or ordering of the badge when multiple are applied.

persona_name.description: Name of the persona used for access control.

persona_description.description: Description of who this persona represents.

persona_policies.description: List of authorization policies attached to this persona.

purpose_name.description: Name of the purpose object (why access is granted).

auth_policy_type.description: Type of policy from AuthPolicyType enumeration.

business_policy_rule.description: Structured rule logic backing the business policy.

business_policy_category.description: Category or grouping for business policies.

incident_status.description: Current lifecycle status of the incident.

incident_category.description: Category or type of incident (data-quality; access; policy; performance).

incident_start_time.description: Timestamp when the incident started or was first detected.

incident_end_time.description: Timestamp when the incident was resolved or closed.

cm_raci_responsible.description: Custom-metadata list of people or groups Responsible (R) in a RACI model.

cm_raci_accountable.description: Custom-metadata list of people or groups Accountable (A).

cm_raci_consulted.description: Custom-metadata list of people or groups Consulted (C).

cm_raci_informed.description: Custom-metadata list of people or groups Informed (I).

cm_ai_risk_rating.description: Custom-metadata risk rating for AI/ML use of this asset.

cm_ai_use_case.description: Custom-metadata description of the AI use case this asset participates in.

cm_ai_business_owner.description: Business owner recorded in the AI governance CM group.

cm_ai_approver.description: Approver or committee recorded in the AI governance CM group.

cm_contract_version.description: Custom-metadata field capturing the data contract version.

cm_contract_status.description: Custom-metadata lifecycle status of the data contract.

cm_contract_breaking_change_policy.description: Custom-metadata description of allowed schema changes under this contract.

data_product_criticality.description: Criticality of a data product (DataProductCriticality enum).

data_product_sensitivity.description: Information sensitivity of a data product (DataProductSensitivity enum).

data_product_status.description: Status of a data product (DataProductStatus enum).

data_product_visibility.description: Visibility of a data product (DataProductVisibility enum).

glossary_terms.description: Glossary terms linked to the asset.

governancePatterns.description: Use badges to visually encode trust and readiness based on metadata coverage, quality, and ownership.
Apply a RACI custom-metadata group to clarify who is Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed for key assets.
Model business policies and attach them to assets via conditions, then raise incidents when breached.
Represent data quality and policy violations as incidents with severity and lifecycle, and connect them to affected assets.
Use personas and purposes to represent who can access which assets and why, and manage access centrally.
Tag models and datasets with AI-specific risk metadata to drive approvals and risk reviews.
Use data contracts (version, status, breaking-change policy) on high-impact producer interfaces to manage change safely.

verticalPatterns.notes: Model subjects, transactions, and models with tight privacy and AI risk fields. Connect incidents to suspicious-activity DQ issues.
Treat core metrics and dashboards as products; use badges and certificates to signal official product analytics.
Heavy emphasis on glossary consistency and owner accountability for revenue metrics.
Carefully model what a segment means, how it’s used, and under what legal basis.
Focus on clear metric definitions and attribution logic to reduce disputes between teams.
Tie DQ and incidents to asset performance KPIs; treat downtime or mis-calibration as data incidents.
Model who owns the definitions of defects and warranty conditions; track incidents when data undermines quality decisions.
Strong emphasis on PHI tagging and AI risk, especially for decision-support models.
Balance analytics value with strict patient privacy and regulatory constraints.

starterModels.name: Core self-service analytics model
starterModels.notes: Baseline enrichment for a first domain. Focus on top assets only; avoid over-modeling every table.

starterModels.name: Regulatory reporting model
starterModels.notes: Use for one regulatory domain (e.g. capital adequacy) to prove out policy + contract + incident modeling.

starterModels.name: Customer 360 & marketing model
starterModels.notes: Focus enrichment on customer & segment tables first; ensure privacy and access model are clear.

starterModels.name: AI / ML risk-aware model
starterModels.notes: Use for a subset of critical models (e.g. credit scoring, underwriting) rather than all experiments.

starterModels.name: Data product portfolio model
starterModels.notes: First step toward a data mesh: define a handful of flagship data products and make their value and risk visible.

ownership.label: Ownership
ownership.requirement: Asset must have at least one owner (user or group) assigned

semantics.label: Description
semantics.requirement: Asset must have a description or user description

lineage.label: Lineage
lineage.requirement: Asset must have upstream or downstream lineage relationships

sensitivity.label: Classification
sensitivity.requirement: Classified fields must have policy protection
sensitivity.action: Apply classifications and policies to sensitive fields

access.label: Policy
access.requirement: Assets with classifications must have access policies defined

usage.label: Usage Telemetry
usage.requirement: Asset must have usage telemetry (query count, popularity)
usage.action: Enable query tracking and popularity signals

freshness.label: Data Quality
freshness.action: Set up data quality monitors and freshness SLAs

retention.label: Retention
retention.requirement: Retention policy evidence should be present
